resources.string: NWT
Welcome!
This string welcomes the user to the app.
User Login
This button is for user login.
Guest Login
This button is for guest login.
Let\'s get started.
You will be asked a series of questions related to your personal finances.
If a question does not apply to you, \n leave it blank
We\'ll do the rest!
Begin
Next
Next Section
Background image for the app.
Back button to return to previous screen.
Forward button to access next screen.
Info icon to display additional information about the question.
Return to Main Screen
Exit to Home
This section will ask about your assets, such as property, real estate, and other topics.
This section will ask about your liabilities, such as loans, taxes, and any other outstanding payments.

string.name: confidentiality_notice
string.i: All responses entered will be kept confidential, and are never saved.

resources.string: Question goes here
Round your answers to the nearest dollar.
Your job is simple: \n Calculate your results, then input them here.
When typing in your response, round to the nearest dollar.
Having an account allows you to save your results, access exclusive tracking tools, and more. Return to the main screen and click on User Login to get started.
This is a popup window.
What is the total dollar amount of the money you currently have in your checking accounts?
What is the total dollar amount of the money you currently have in your savings accounts?
What is the total dollar amount of the money you currently have in your retirement accounts?
What is the total current market value of the money you have in your investment accounts?
What is the total number of cash you have on hand?
What is the current market value of your home(s)?
What is the current value of your business activities and/or any venues you may own?
What is the cash value of any insurance policies you are associated with?
What is the total value of your car(s), with depreciation costs accounted for?
What is the value of any other personal property or assets that you own (jewelry, art, furniture, etc.)?
List the outstanding balances on your credit card(s), if any.
List the value of outstanding housing mortgage payment(s) you have, if any.
List the value of student loans you may have, if any.
List the total amount of car loans you have, if any.
List the total amount of taxes due, if applicable.
List the total amount of bills that must be paid, if any.
List the total amount of rent due, if any.
List any other debt, loans, or outstanding payments due, if any.
Calculate your total checking account funds from all the bank accounts you have.
Calculate your total savings account funds from all the bank accounts you have.
Calculate your total retirement account funds from all the bank accounts you have.
Calculate the value of your total investments, if any, at their market value. Examples of investment items you may include are real estate, stock, bonds, cryptocurrency, and CDs.
Calculate the cash you have physically, such as cash that is stored in a safe, at your home, in your wallet, car, or other locations.

Calculate the current market value of your home(s) using tools you have at your disposal. The value at which you bought your home and what it is worth now will likely differ. These tools may be online evaluation tools or documents.
Calculate the current value of any business activities or ventures you may personally own and operate.
Insurance policies may include policies such as life insurance. Include such policies, if any, here.

Calculate the total cash value of your car(s) by taking the original value of your car and subtracting from it depreciation. Depreciation is easily calculated using online tools to help you understand what your car(s) are currently worth.
Calculate the total value of any other assets you own. These may include things such as property, furniture, art, jewelery, antique items, and anything else you believe is worth mentioning.
Calculate the total amount of money you owe on your credit cards, if any.
Calculate the total amount of money you owe on your mortgage payments, if any.
Calculate the total amount of money you owe on student loans, if any.
Calculate the total amount of money you owe on your car loans, if any.
Calculate the total amount of money due as part of your annual taxes, if any.
Calculate the total amount of money due as part of any outstanding bills, such as electricity or heating bills.
Calculate the total amount of money that you owe for rent payment(s), if any.
Calculate any other debt, loans, outstanding payments or any other items, if applicable.
Placeholder
Type here
